bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definitions

bcl:text.#text: means the period beginning on December 31, 2016 and ending on December 31, 2026;

bcl:text.in:term: AAC determined by the chief forester
bcl:text.#text: has the meaning set out in section 4;

bcl:text.in:term: AAC partition specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council
bcl:text.#text: has the meaning set out in section 5;

bcl:text.in:term: AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council
bcl:text.#text: has the meaning set out in section 3;
, in relation to a timber supply area, does not include Crown land in the following areas:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a tree farm licence area;
a community forest agreement area;
a first nations woodland licence area;
a woodlot licence area;

bcl:text.#text: means Great Bear Rainforest;
means the area designated under section 6  as the forest management area for the Great Bear Rainforest;
, in relation to a partial GBR timber supply area or partial GBR tree farm licence area, means the part of the area located in the GBR forest management area;
means a timber supply area located, in whole, in the GBR forest management area;
means a tree farm licence area located, in whole, in the GBR forest management area;
means land outside the GBR forest management area that is designated under section 8 (1) (c)  as a timber supply area;
, in relation to a partial GBR timber supply area or partial GBR tree farm licence area, means the part of the area located outside the GBR forest management area;
, in relation to

bcl:text: means the part of the area located north of the southern boundary of the Mid Coast Timber Supply Area, as that timber supply area existed immediately before December 31, 2016;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the GBR forest management area,
a GBR timber supply area or GBR tree farm licence area, or
a partial GBR timber supply area or partial GBR tree farm licence area,

bcl:text.#text: means a timber supply area located, in part, in the GBR forest management area;

bcl:text.in:term: partial GBR tree farm licence area
bcl:text.#text: means a tree farm licence area located, in part, in the GBR forest management area;
, in relation to

bcl:text: means the part of the area located south of the southern boundary of the Mid Coast Timber Supply Area, as that timber supply area existed immediately before December 31, 2016;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the GBR forest management area,
a GBR timber supply area or GBR tree farm licence area, or
a partial GBR timber supply area or partial GBR tree farm licence area,

bcl:text.#text: means land in the GBR forest management area that is designated under section 50  as a special forest management area.

bcl:marginalnote.#text: General application of  to this Act

bcl:text.#text: If a word or expression used in this Act is defined in the , the word or expression has the same meaning in this Act as in the , unless the context indicates otherwise.

If a licence, agreement or permit listed in section 12  of the  is referred to in this Act, the licence, agreement or permit has the same meaning in this Act as in the , unless the context indicates otherwise.

The minister may delegate a power or duty under this Act and for this purpose, subject to subsection (4), section 1.1  of the  applies, as if the power or duty of the minister under this Act were a power or duty of the minister under the .
In applying section 1.1 of the  for the purposes of subsection (3) of this section, section 1.1 is to be read as if
the references to the  in that section were references to this Act, and
the reference to "Subject to a regulation made under section 151 (2) (b.1)" in that section were a reference to "Subject to a regulation made under section 68 (a)  of this Act".
For certainty, subject to and in accordance with this Act, the  applies in relation to the GBR forest management area.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of this Act, the AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council, if specified for

bcl:text.in:desc: [AAC for GBR timber supply areas and GBR tree farm licence areas]
bcl:text.#text: a GBR timber supply area, is the allowable annual cut for the Crown land in the GBR timber supply area, as specified by regulation under section 9 (1) (a) ,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a GBR tree farm licence area, is the allowable annual cut for the GBR tree farm licence area, as specified by regulation under section 9 (1) (b),

the north part of a GBR tree farm licence area, is the portion of the allowable annual cut for the GBR tree farm licence area that is allocated by regulation under section 9 (2) (a) to that north part of the GBR tree farm licence area,

the south part of a GBR tree farm licence area, is the portion of the allowable annual cut for the GBR tree farm licence area that is allocated by regulation under section 9 (2) (b) to that south part of the GBR tree farm licence area,

bcl:text.in:desc: [AAC for new non-GBR timber supply areas]
bcl:text.#text: a new non-GBR timber supply area, is the allowable annual cut for the Crown land in the new non-GBR timber supply area, as specified by regulation under section 11 (1) ,

bcl:text.in:desc: [AAC for partial GBR timber supply areas and partial GBR tree farm licence areas]
bcl:text.#text: the GBR part of a partial GBR timber supply area, is the allowable annual cut for the Crown land in that GBR part of the partial GBR timber supply area, as specified by regulation under section 13 (1) (a) ,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the GBR part of a partial GBR tree farm licence area, is the allowable annual cut for that GBR part of the partial GBR tree farm licence area, as specified by regulation under section 13 (1) (b),

the non-GBR part of a partial GBR timber supply area, is the allowable annual cut for the Crown land in that non-GBR part of the partial GBR timber supply area, as specified by regulation under section 13 (2), and
the non-GBR part of a partial GBR tree farm licence area, is the allowable annual cut for that non-GBR part of the partial GBR tree farm licence area, as specified by regulation under section 13 (3).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council by a regulation referred to in subsection (1) takes effect on the date the regulation takes effect.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: AAC determined by the chief forester

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of this Act, the AAC determined by the chief forester, if determined for

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a GBR timber supply area, is the allowable annual cut for the Crown land in the GBR timber supply area, as determined by the chief forester

bcl:text.#text: under section 8 (1)  of the , and

bcl:text.in:desc: [AAC for GBR timber supply areas and GBR tree farm licence areas]
bcl:text.#text: in accordance with section 9 (3) (b)  of this Act,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a GBR tree farm licence area, is the allowable annual cut for the GBR tree farm licence area, as determined by the chief forester

bcl:text.#text: under section 8 (1) of the , and

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in accordance with section 9 (3) (b) of this Act,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a new non-GBR timber supply area, is the allowable annual cut for the Crown land in the new non-GBR timber supply area, as determined by the chief forester

bcl:text.#text: under section 8 (1) of the , and

bcl:text.in:desc: [AAC for new non-GBR timber supply areas]
bcl:text.#text: in accordance with section 11 (2)  of this Act,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the non-GBR part of a partial GBR timber supply area, is the allowable annual cut for the Crown land in that non-GBR part of the partial GBR timber supply area, as determined by the chief forester

bcl:text.#text: under section 8 (1) of the , and

bcl:text.in:desc: [AAC for partial GBR timber supply areas and partial GBR tree farm licence areas]
bcl:text.#text: in accordance with section 13 (4) (a)  of this Act,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the non-GBR part of a partial GBR tree farm licence area, is the allowable annual cut for that non-GBR part of the partial GBR tree farm licence area, as determined by the chief forester

bcl:text.#text: under section 8 (1) of the , and

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in accordance with section 13 (4) (a) of this Act,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a partial GBR timber supply area, is the allowable annual cut for the partial GBR timber supply area, as determined by the chief forester

bcl:text.#text: under section 8 (1) of the , and

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in accordance with section 13 (4) (c) of this Act, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a partial GBR tree farm licence area, is the allowable annual cut for the Crown land in the partial GBR tree farm licence area, as determined by the chief forester

bcl:text.#text: under section 8 (1) of the , and

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in accordance with section 13 (4) (c) of this Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An AAC determined by the chief forester takes effect on the date specified in the determination.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: AAC partition specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council

bcl:text.#text: In this section,  has the same meaning as in section 20 .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of this Act, an AAC partition specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council, if specified in relation to the AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for

bcl:text.in:desc: [AAC partitions for GBR timber supply areas and GBR tree farm licence areas]
bcl:text.#text: a GBR timber supply area, is a partition of that allowable annual cut, as specified by regulation under section 21 (1) (a) ,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a GBR tree farm licence area, is a partition of that allowable annual cut, as specified by regulation under section 21 (1) (b),
the north part of a GBR tree farm licence area, is a partition of that allowable annual cut, as specified by regulation under section 21 (1) (c),
the south part of a GBR tree farm licence area, is a partition of that allowable annual cut, as specified by regulation under section 21 (1) (d),

bcl:text.in:desc: [AAC partitions for new non-GBR timber supply areas]
bcl:text.#text: a new non-GBR timber supply area, is a partition of that allowable annual cut, as specified by regulation under section 22 (1) ,

bcl:text.in:desc: [AAC partitions for partial GBR timber supply areas and partial GBR tree farm licence areas]
bcl:text.#text: the GBR part of a partial GBR timber supply area, is a partition of that allowable annual cut, as specified by regulation under section 23 (1) (a) ,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the GBR part of a partial GBR tree farm licence area, is a partition of that allowable annual cut, as specified by regulation under section 23 (1) (b),
the non-GBR part of a partial GBR timber supply area, is a partition of that allowable annual cut, as specified by regulation under section 23 (2), and
the non-GBR part of a partial GBR tree farm licence area, is a partition of that allowable annual cut, as specified by regulation under section 23 (3).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An AAC partition specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council by a regulation referred to in subsection (2) takes effect on the date the regulation takes effect.

bcl:part.bcl:text: Forest Management Area for the Great Bear Rainforest

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Designation of GBR forest management area

bcl:text.#text: In this section,  means the map deposited in the Media Vault, GeoBC, Victoria as Map of Great Bear Rainforest Forest Management Area, reference number 577.3409711 G786 2016.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The area contained within the boundaries shown and described on the official map is designated as the forest management area for the Great Bear Rainforest.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Maximum AAC for GBR forest management area

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: During the AAC adjustment period, the Lieutenant Governor in Council may by regulation specify a maximum allowable annual cut for the GBR forest management area.

If a maximum allowable annual cut for the GBR forest management area is in effect on the date the AAC adjustment period ends, the maximum allowable annual cut ceases to have effect when the AAC adjustment period ends.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Adjustments to timber supply areas

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: During the AAC adjustment period, the Lieutenant Governor in Council may by regulation do any or all of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in respect of a timber supply area that is a GBR timber supply area or a partial GBR timber supply area,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: divide the timber supply area into 2 or more other timber supply areas,
consolidate the timber supply area or a part of the timber supply area with all or part of one or more other GBR timber supply areas or partial GBR timber supply areas,
abolish the timber supply area or a part of the timber supply area, or
change the boundaries of the timber supply area;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: designate land in the GBR forest management area as a timber supply area;

designate land outside the GBR forest management area as a timber supply area if, immediately before a division, consolidation, abolition or boundary change under paragraph (a), the land was in the non-GBR part of a partial GBR timber supply area.

bcl:text.#text: Land designated as a timber supply area under subsection (1) (b) or (c) is deemed to be land designated as a timber supply area under section 7  of the .
Despite subsection (2), the minister may not, until after the end of the AAC adjustment period, make a designation or order under section 7 of the  in relation to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: land in the GBR forest management area, or
a GBR timber supply area or partial GBR timber supply area.

bcl:text.#text: For certainty, if land is designated as a new non-GBR timber supply area, the minister may, during or after the end of the AAC adjustment period, make a designation or order under section 7 (a) or (b) of the  in relation to the new non-GBR timber supply area.

For certainty, a regulation under subsection (1) that divides, consolidates, abolishes or changes the boundaries of a timber supply area is not deemed to be an order made by the minister under section 7 (b) of the .

bcl:part.bcl:text: Allowable Annual Cut for Timber Supply Areas and Tree Farm Licence Areas

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: AAC for GBR timber supply areas and GBR tree farm licence areas

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: During the AAC adjustment period, the Lieutenant Governor in Council may by regulation specify an allowable annual cut for any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the Crown land in a GBR timber supply area;
a GBR tree farm licence area.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the Lieutenant Governor in Council specifies an allowable annual cut for a GBR tree farm licence area located, in part, in the north part of the GBR forest management area, the Lieutenant Governor in Council may by regulation allocate that allowable annual cut between

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the north part of the GBR tree farm licence area, and
the south part of the GBR tree farm licence area.

bcl:text.#text: In respect of an area that is a GBR timber supply area or GBR tree farm licence area, if an allowable annual cut is specified under subsection (1) for the area, the powers and duties of the chief forester under section 8 (1)  of the  are subject to the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: during the AAC adjustment period, the chief forester must not determine an allowable annual cut for that area;
within 5 years after the end of the AAC adjustment period, the chief forester must determine an allowable annual cut for that area.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (3) applies despite the following provisions of this Act:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: section 8 (2);

bcl:text.in:desc: [application of Forest Act to AACs specified under this Act]
bcl:text.#text: section 16 (1) (a) and (b) .

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: AAC status — GBR timber supply areas and GBR tree farm licence areas

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If an allowable annual cut is specified under section 9 (1) for an area that is a GBR timber supply area or GBR tree farm licence area, the allowable annual cut for the area is, until the chief forester makes the determination referred to in subsection (2) of this section, the AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for that area.
When the chief forester, after the end of the AAC adjustment period, determines an allowable annual cut for the area referred to in subsection (1),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for that area ceases to have effect, and
the allowable annual cut for the area is the AAC determined by the chief forester for that area.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: AAC for new non-GBR timber supply areas

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If and when the Lieutenant Governor in Council designates land as a new non-GBR timber supply area, the Lieutenant Governor in Council must also by regulation specify the first allowable annual cut for the Crown land in the new non-GBR timber supply area.

bcl:text.#text: If the first allowable annual cut is specified under subsection (1) for a new non-GBR timber supply area, subsequent allowable annual cuts for the Crown land in the area must be determined by the chief forester, under section 8 (1)  of the , within the time periods required under that section.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: AAC status — new non-GBR timber supply areas

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If an allowable annual cut is specified under section 11 (1) for a new non-GBR timber supply area, the allowable annual cut for the area is, until the chief forester makes the determination referred to subsection (2), the AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for that area.
When the chief forester, during or after the end of the AAC adjustment period, determines an allowable annual cut for the new non-GBR timber supply area,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for the area ceases to have effect, and
the allowable annual cut for the area is the AAC determined by the chief forester for that area.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: AAC for partial GBR timber supply areas and partial GBR tree farm licence areas

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: During the AAC adjustment period, the Lieutenant Governor in Council may by regulation specify an allowable annual cut for any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the Crown land in the GBR part of a partial GBR timber supply area;
the GBR part of a partial GBR tree farm licence area.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If and when the first allowable annual cut is specified under subsection (1) (a) for the GBR part of a partial GBR timber supply area, the Lieutenant Governor in Council must also by regulation specify the allowable annual cut for the Crown land in the non-GBR part of the area.

If and when the first allowable annual cut is specified under subsection (1) (b) for the GBR part of a partial GBR tree farm licence area, the Lieutenant Governor in Council must also by regulation specify the allowable annual cut for the non-GBR part of the area.

bcl:text.#text: In respect of an area that is a partial GBR timber supply area or partial GBR tree farm licence area, if an allowable annual cut is specified under subsection (1) for the GBR part of the area, the powers and duties of the chief forester under section 8 (1)  of the  are subject to the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: after the Lieutenant Governor in Council specifies the first allowable annual cut for the non-GBR part of that area, the chief forester may, during the AAC adjustment period, determine an allowable annual cut for that non-GBR part of that area;
during the AAC adjustment period, the chief forester must not determine an allowable annual cut for that area, except to the extent permitted under paragraph (a) of this subsection;
within 5 years after the end of the AAC adjustment period, the chief forester must determine an allowable annual cut for that area.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In determining an allowable annual cut, if any, for the non-GBR part of an area that is a partial GBR timber supply area or partial GBR tree farm licence area, the chief forester

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may consider the AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for the GBR part of the area, and

bcl:text.#text: in addition to considering the matters set out in section 8 (8) of the  in relation to the non-GBR part of the area, may also consider those matters as they relate to the whole area.

The chief forester may exercise the powers under subsection (4) (a) despite the chief forester's duty, under section 8 (1) of the , to determine an allowable annual cut for a whole timber supply area or tree farm licence area.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (4) applies despite the following provisions of this Act:

bcl:text.#text: section 8 (2) ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [application of Forest Act to AACs specified under this Act]
bcl:text.#text: section 16 (1) (d) to (g) .

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: AAC status — partial GBR timber supply areas and partial GBR tree farm licence areas

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If an allowable annual cut is specified under section 13 (1) for the GBR part of an area that is a partial GBR timber supply area or partial GBR tree farm licence area, the allowable annual cut for the area is, until the chief forester makes the determination referred to in subsection (3) of this section, the aggregate of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for the GBR part of the area, and
the allowable annual cut for the non-GBR part of the area, as described in subsection (2).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsections (1) (b) and (3) (b),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the allowable annual cut for the non-GBR part of the area is, unless the chief forester makes the determination referred to in paragraph (b) of this subsection, the AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for that non-GBR part of the area, and
if the chief forester, during the AAC adjustment period, determines an allowable annual cut for that non-GBR part of the area,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for that non-GBR part of the area ceases to have effect, and
the allowable annual cut for the non-GBR part of the area is the AAC determined by the chief forester for that non-GBR part of that area.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: When the chief forester, after the end of the AAC adjustment period, determines an allowable annual cut for the area referred to in subsection (1),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for the GBR part of the area ceases to have effect,
the allowable annual cut for the non-GBR part of the area, as described in subsection (2), ceases to have effect, and
the allowable annual cut for the area is the AAC determined by the chief forester for that area.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Aggregate AAC must not exceed maximum AAC

bcl:text.in:desc: [maximum AAC for GBR forest management area]
bcl:text.#text: The aggregate of the AACs specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for the following areas and parts of areas must not exceed the maximum allowable annual cut specified under section 7 (1)  for the GBR forest management area:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: each GBR timber supply area;
each GBR tree farm licence area;
the GBR part of each partial GBR timber supply area;
the GBR part of each partial GBR tree farm licence area.

bcl:marginalnote.#text: Application of  to AACs specified under this Act

bcl:text.#text: The AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for the following areas or parts of an area is deemed to be the allowable annual cut determined by the chief forester, under section 8 (1)  of the , for that area or part of the area:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a GBR timber supply area;
a GBR tree farm licence area;
a new non-GBR timber supply area;
the GBR part of a partial GBR timber supply area;
the GBR part of a partial GBR tree farm licence area;
the non-GBR part of a partial GBR timber supply area;
the non-GBR part of a partial GBR tree farm licence area.

bcl:text.#text: For certainty, section 8 (8) of the  does not apply to the Lieutenant Governor in Council in specifying an allowable annual cut for an area or part of an area referred to in subsection (1) of this section.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Apportioning cut in GBR areas

bcl:text.#text: In specifying the allowable annual cut under Division 1  for a GBR timber supply area, or for the GBR part of a partial GBR timber supply area, the Lieutenant Governor in Council may also by regulation specify the portions of that allowable annual cut that are to be made available to one or both of the following:
the minister, for the purposes of granting under agreements referred to in section 12 (1)  of the ;
the timber sales manager, for the purposes of granting under agreements referred to in section 12 (2) of the .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A regulation under subsection (1) may also identify the portions of the allowable annual cut that are to be made available specifically for the north part or the south part of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the GBR timber supply area, or
the GBR part of the partial GBR timber supply area.

bcl:text.#text: The minister may not, until after the end of the AAC adjustment period, exercise a power under section 10 (1)  of the  in relation to an AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a GBR timber supply area, or
the GBR part of a partial GBR timber supply area.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (3) applies despite the following provisions of this Act:

bcl:text.#text: section 8 (2) ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: section 16 (1) (a) and (d);

bcl:text.in:desc: [application of Forest Act to apportionments specified under this Act]
bcl:text.#text: section 19 .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If an apportionment is specified under subsection (1) in relation to an AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for a GBR timber supply area or the GBR part of a partial GBR timber supply area, the apportionment ceases to have effect on

bcl:text.#text: the date on which the minister, after the end of the AAC adjustment period, exercises a power under section 10 (1) of the  in relation to the AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for the GBR timber supply area or the GBR part of the partial GBR timber supply area, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the minister does not exercise the power referred to in paragraph (a) of this subsection, the effective date of the AAC determined by the chief forester for that GBR timber supply area or partial GBR timber supply area.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Apportioning cut in non-GBR areas

bcl:text.#text: In specifying the allowable annual cut under Division 1  for a new non-GBR timber supply area, or for the non-GBR part of a partial GBR timber supply area, the Lieutenant Governor in Council may also by regulation specify the portions of that allowable annual cut that are to be made available to one or both of the following:
the minister, for the purposes of granting under agreements referred to in section 12 (1)  of the ;
the timber sales manager, for the purposes of granting under agreements referred to in section 12 (2) of the .

For certainty, during or after the end of the AAC adjustment period, and whether or not the Lieutenant Governor in Council has exercised a power under subsection (1), the minister may exercise a power under section 10 (1)  of the  in relation to the AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a new non-GBR timber supply area, or
the non-GBR part of a partial GBR timber supply area.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If an apportionment is specified under subsection (1) in relation to an AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for a new non-GBR timber supply area, the apportionment ceases to have effect on

bcl:text.#text: the date on which the minister, during or after the end of the AAC adjustment period, exercises a power under section 10 (1) of the  in relation to the AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for the new non-GBR timber supply area, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the minister does not exercise the power referred to in paragraph (a) of this subsection, the effective date of the AAC determined by the chief forester for that new non-GBR timber supply area.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If an apportionment is specified under subsection (1) in relation to an AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for the non-GBR part of a partial GBR timber supply area, the apportionment ceases to have effect on

bcl:text.#text: the date on which the minister, during or after the end of the AAC adjustment period, exercises a power under section 10 (1) of the  in relation to the AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for that non-GBR part of the partial GBR timber supply area,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the minister does not exercise the power referred to in paragraph (a) of this subsection, the effective date of the AAC determined by the chief forester for that non-GBR part of the partial GBR timber supply area, or

if the minister does not exercise the power referred to in paragraph (a) and the chief forester does not make the determination referred to in paragraph (b) of this subsection, the effective date of the AAC determined by the chief forester for the partial GBR timber supply area.

bcl:marginalnote.#text: Application of  to apportionments specified under this Act

bcl:text.#text: A portion of an allowable annual cut specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council under section 17  or 18 is deemed to be a portion of an allowable annual cut specified by the minister under section 10 (1)  of the .

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definition for Division 3 of Part 3

bcl:text.#text: In this Division, , in relation to the allowable annual cut for an area that is

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a GBR timber supply area, a new non-GBR timber supply area, a partial GBR timber supply area or the GBR part or non-GBR part of a partial GBR timber supply area, means to specify that portions of that allowable annual cut are attributable to one or more of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: different types of timber or terrain in different parts of Crown land within the area or part of the area;
different areas of Crown land within the area or part of the area, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a GBR tree farm licence area, the north part or south part of a GBR tree farm licence area, a partial GBR tree farm licence area or the GBR part or non-GBR part of a partial GBR tree farm licence area, means to specify that portions of that allowable annual cut are attributable to one or more of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: different types of timber or terrain in different parts of Crown land within the area or part of the area;
different areas of Crown land within the area or part of the area;
different types of timber or terrain in different parts of private land within the area or part of the area.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: AAC partitions for GBR timber supply areas and GBR tree farm licence areas

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: During the AAC adjustment period, the Lieutenant Governor in Council may by regulation partition the AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a GBR timber supply area;
a GBR tree farm licence area;
the north part of a GBR tree farm licence area;
the south part of a GBR tree farm licence area.

bcl:text.#text: The chief forester must not, until after the end of the AAC adjustment period, exercise a power under section 8 (5) or (5.1) of the  in relation to the AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a GBR timber supply area, or
a GBR tree farm licence area.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (2) applies despite the following provisions of this Act:

bcl:text.#text: section 8 (2) ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [application of Forest Act to AACs specified under this Act]
bcl:text.#text: section 16 (1) (a) and (b) ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [application of Forest Act to AAC partitions specified under this Act]
bcl:text.#text: section 25 .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An AAC partition specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council in relation to an area or a part of an area referred to in subsection (1) ceases to have effect on

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the date on which the chief forester, after the end of the AAC adjustment period, partitions the AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for the area, or

if the chief forester, after the end of the AAC adjustment period, does not partition the AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for the area, the effective date of the AAC determined by the chief forester for that area.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: AAC partitions for new non-GBR timber supply areas

bcl:text.in:desc: [AAC for new non-GBR timber supply areas]
bcl:text.#text: If and when the Lieutenant Governor in Council, by regulation under section 11 (1) , specifies the first allowable annual cut for a new non-GBR timber supply area, the Lieutenant Governor in Council may also by regulation partition that allowable annual cut.

During or after the end of the AAC adjustment period, the chief forester may partition, under section 8 (5)  of the , the AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for a new non-GBR timber supply area.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An AAC partition specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council in relation to a new non-GBR timber supply area ceases to have effect on

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the date on which the chief forester, during or after the end of the AAC adjustment period, partitions the AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for the area, or
if the chief forester does not partition the AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for the area, the effective date of the AAC determined by the chief forester for that area.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: AAC partitions for partial GBR timber supply areas and partial GBR tree farm licence areas

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: During the AAC adjustment period, the Lieutenant Governor in Council may by regulation partition the AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the GBR part of a partial GBR timber supply area;
the GBR part of a partial GBR tree farm licence area.

bcl:text.in:desc: [AAC for partial GBR timber supply areas and partial GBR tree farm licence areas]
bcl:text.#text: If and when the Lieutenant Governor in Council, by regulation under section 13 (2) , specifies the first allowable annual cut for the non-GBR part of a partial GBR timber supply area, the Lieutenant Governor in Council may also by regulation partition that allowable annual cut.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If and when the Lieutenant Governor in Council, by regulation under section 13 (3), specifies the first allowable annual cut for the non-GBR part of a partial GBR tree farm licence area, the Lieutenant Governor in Council may also by regulation partition that allowable annual cut.

bcl:text.#text: In respect of an area that is a partial GBR timber supply area or partial GBR tree farm licence area, the power of the chief forester, under section 8 (5)  of the , to partition the allowable annual cut for the area is subject to the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: during the AAC adjustment period, the chief forester may partition

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for the non-GBR part of that area, or
the AAC determined by the chief forester for the non-GBR part of that area;

bcl:text.#text: during the AAC adjustment period, the chief forester must not exercise a power under section 8 (5) or (5.1) of the  in relation to an allowable annual cut for that area, except to the extent permitted under paragraph (a) of this subsection;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: after the end of the AAC adjustment period, the chief forester may partition the aggregate of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for the GBR part of that area, and

bcl:text.in:desc: [AAC status — partial GBR timber supply areas and partial GBR tree farm licence areas]
bcl:text.#text: the allowable annual cut for the non-GBR part of that area, as described in section 14 (2)  of this Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (4) (b) applies despite the following provisions of this Act:

bcl:text.#text: section 8 (2) ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [application of Forest Act to AACs specified under this Act]
bcl:text.#text: section 16 (1) (d) to (g) ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [application of Forest Act to AAC partitions specified under this Act]
bcl:text.#text: section 25 .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An AAC partition specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council in relation to the GBR part of an area that is a partial GBR timber supply area or partial GBR tree farm licence area ceases to have effect on

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the date on which the chief forester, after the end of the AAC adjustment period, partitions the aggregate of the allowable annual cuts referred to in subsection (4) (c), or

if the chief forester, after the end of the AAC adjustment period, does not partition the aggregate of the allowable annual cuts referred to in subsection (4) (c), the effective date of the AAC determined by the chief forester for the area.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An AAC partition specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council in relation to the non-GBR part of an area that is a partial GBR timber supply area or partial GBR tree farm licence area ceases to have effect on

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the date on which the chief forester, during the AAC adjustment period, partitions the AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for that non-GBR part of the area,
if the chief forester does not specify a partition referred to in paragraph (a), the effective date of the AAC determined by the chief forester for that non-GBR part of the area, or

if the chief forester does not specify a partition referred to in paragraph (a) and does not determine an allowable annual cut referred to in paragraph (b), the effective date of the AAC determined by the chief forester for the area.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Duty of chief forester to advise minister
bcl:section.bcl:text: The chief forester must advise the minister if the chief forester considers that the AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for

bcl:text.in:desc: [AAC partitions for GBR timber supply areas and GBR tree farm licence areas]
bcl:text.#text: a GBR timber supply area or GBR tree farm licence area should be partitioned under section 21 (1) , or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the GBR part of a partial GBR timber supply area or partial GBR tree farm licence area should be partitioned under section 23 (1).

bcl:marginalnote.#text: Application of  to AAC partitions specified under this Act

bcl:text.#text: An AAC partition specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council in relation to the AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for any of the following areas or parts of an area is deemed to be a partition specified by the chief forester, under section 8 (5)  of the , in relation to the area or part of the area:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a GBR timber supply area;
a GBR tree farm licence area;
the north part of a GBR tree farm licence area;
the south part of a GBR tree farm licence area;
a new non-GBR timber supply area;
the GBR part of a partial GBR timber supply area;
the GBR part of a partial GBR tree farm licence area;
the non-GBR part of a partial GBR timber supply area;
the non-GBR part of a partial GBR tree farm licence area.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definitions for Part 4

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this Part:

bcl:text.#text: means a forest licence that is one of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a forest licence that, immediately before January 1, 2017, specified, as the area in which the holder of the licence may harvest Crown timber,

bcl:text.#text: a timber supply area located, in whole or in part, in the area referred to in section 6 , or

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a tree farm licence area located, in whole or in part, in the area referred to in section 6;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a forest licence entered into after January 1, 2017 that specifies, as the area in which the holder of the licence may harvest Crown timber,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a GBR timber supply area or partial GBR timber supply area, or
a GBR tree farm licence area or partial GBR tree farm licence area;

bcl:text.#text: means a forest licence that is one of the following:
a forest licence that specifies an allowable annual cut of 10 000 m or less;
a forest licence that is entered into under section 47.3  of the  with a first nation or a representative of a first nation;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a forest licence that is a prescribed forest licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For certainty,

bcl:text.#text: an affected forest licence includes a forest licence that is an affected forest licence as a result of deemed amendments made to that licence under section 30 , and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an exempt forest licence includes a forest licence that is an exempt forest licence as a result of deemed amendments made to that licence under section 30.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Specification of AACs for affected forest licences and new forest licences

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: During the AAC adjustment period, the Lieutenant Governor in Council may by regulation specify the allowable annual cut that may be harvested under any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an affected forest licence, other than an exempt forest licence;

bcl:text.#text: a new forest licence that specifies a new non-GBR timber supply area as the area in which the holder of the licence may harvest Crown timber, if that licence is entered into with the holder of an affected forest licence in accordance with section 29 .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An allowable annual cut specified by regulation under subsection (1) (a) for an affected forest licence, other than an affected forest licence to which subsection (3) applies,

bcl:text.#text: must be greater than 10 000 m, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must not be greater than the allowable annual cut specified in the affected forest licence, as that licence read immediately before the coming into force of the regulation.

bcl:text: If a regulation under section 28 (3) specifies that the holder of an affected forest licence may also harvest Crown timber in a new non-GBR timber supply area under a new forest licence, the aggregate of the allowable annual cuts specified under subsection (1) of this section for
must not be greater than the allowable annual cut specified in the affected forest licence, as that licence read immediately before January 1, 2017.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the affected forest licence, and
the new forest licence

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Specification of harvesting areas for affected forest licences

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: During the AAC adjustment period, the Lieutenant Governor in Council may by regulation specify one of the following as the area in which the holder of an affected forest licence may harvest Crown timber under the affected forest licence:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a GBR timber supply area;
a GBR tree farm licence area;
a new non-GBR timber supply area;
a partial GBR timber supply area;
a partial GBR tree farm licence area.

bcl:text.#text: During the AAC adjustment period, the Lieutenant Governor in Council, despite section 14 (1) (b.1) and (2)  of the , may by regulation require that timber harvesting under an affected forest licence be restricted to one or more of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a portion of an area specified under subsection (1) of this section;
a type of timber;
a type of terrain.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: During the AAC adjustment period, the Lieutenant Governor in Council may by regulation specify that the holder of an affected forest licence for which an area is specified by regulation under subsection (1) (a) may also harvest Crown timber in a new non-GBR timber supply area under a new forest licence that may be entered into with the holder of the affected forest licence in accordance with section 29.
A regulation may be made under subsection (3) only if,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: immediately before the coming into force of the regulation under subsection (1) (a), the affected forest licence specified a partial GBR timber supply area as the area in which timber may be harvested under that licence, and
land in the non-GBR part of the partial GBR timber supply area referred to in paragraph (a) of this subsection is designated as a new non-GBR timber supply area.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Direct award of new forest licences

bcl:text.#text: If a regulation under section 28 (3) specifies that the holder of an affected forest licence may harvest Crown timber in a new non-GBR timber supply area, the minister may enter into a new forest licence, under section 13  of the , with that holder of the affected forest licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may exercise the power under subsection (1) despite

bcl:text.#text: section 11  of the , and
the requirements set out in section 13  of the .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following apply in relation to a new forest licence entered into with the holder of an affected forest licence in accordance with this section:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the new forest licence must specify a term that expires on the expiry date of the affected forest licence;

the new forest licence must specify, as the area in which the holder of the new forest licence may harvest Crown timber, the new non-GBR timber supply area specified for that licence by regulation under section 28 (3);

bcl:text.in:desc: [specification of AACs for affected forest licences and new forest licences]
bcl:text.#text: the new forest licence must specify, as the allowable annual cut for the licence, the allowable annual cut specified for that licence by regulation under section 27 (1) (b) ;
if the affected forest licence is replaceable under section 15  of the ,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the new forest licence must be replaceable on the same terms and conditions as the affected forest licence, and

for the purpose of determining the obligations relating to replacement under the new forest licence, the new forest licence is deemed to have been issued at the same time as the affected forest licence;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if a bonus bid was required for the affected forest licence,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the new forest licence must require the same bonus bid as under the affected forest licence, and
the bonus bid required under subparagraph (i) is deemed to have been tendered for the new forest licence;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in respect of the volume of timber harvested that, before the new forest licence is entered into, was charged to the affected forest licence, the minister must assign that volume or portions of that volume that the minister considers appropriate to one or both of the affected forest licence and the new forest licence;
the first cut control period for the new forest licence is deemed to have begun on the same day as the current cut control period for the affected forest licence;

bcl:text.#text: subject to subsection (4), the new forest licence must include other terms and conditions that are required under section 14 (1)  of the  to be included in that licence;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the new forest licence may include other terms and conditions the minister considers appropriate.

bcl:text.#text: The following provisions of the  do not apply to a new forest licence entered into in accordance with this section:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: section 14 (1) (d) (iii), except to the extent, if any, required under subsection (3) (e) of this subsection;
section 14 (2);

bcl:text.#text: section 26 (5) .
In subsection (3) (g),  means the cut control period that applies to the affected forest licence at the time the new forest licence is entered into.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Deemed amendments to affected forest licences

bcl:text.in:desc: [specification of AACs for affected forest licences and new forest licences]
bcl:text.#text: If a regulation under section 27 (1) (a)  specifies an allowable annual cut for an affected forest licence,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the affected forest licence is deemed to be amended, on the date the regulation takes effect, to reflect the allowable annual cut specified in that regulation, and

bcl:text.#text: the regulation ceases to have effect if a different allowable annual cut is subsequently authorized under the  for that affected forest licence.

bcl:text.in:desc: [specification of harvesting areas for affected forest licences]
bcl:text.#text: If a regulation under section 28 (1)  specifies an area for an affected forest licence,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the affected forest licence is deemed to be amended, on the date the regulation takes effect, to reflect the area specified in that regulation, and

bcl:text.#text: the regulation ceases to have effect if a different area is subsequently specified under the  for that affected forest licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a regulation under section 28 (2) imposes a restriction on timber harvesting under an affected forest licence,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the affected forest licence is deemed to be amended, on the date the regulation takes effect, to reflect the restriction imposed by that regulation, and

bcl:text.#text: the regulation ceases to have effect if that restriction is subsequently removed under the  in relation to that affected forest licence.

bcl:marginalnote.#text: Restriction on minister's powers under sections 18 and 25 of

bcl:text.#text: Despite section 8 (2) , the minister may not, until after the end of the AAC adjustment period, exercise a power under the following sections of the  in relation to a GBR timber supply area or partial GBR timber supply area:
section 18 ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [permanent transfer to adjacent timber supply area]
bcl:text.#text: section 25 .

in:desc: [application of Forest Act to AACs specified under this Act]
bcl:text.#text: Despite sections 8 (2)  and 16 (1) (a), (c), (d) and (f) , section 63  of the  does not apply in relation to the AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a GBR timber supply area;
a new non-GBR timber supply area;
the GBR part of a partial GBR timber supply area;
the non-GBR part of a partial GBR timber supply area.

bcl:text.#text: In applying section 63 of the  in relation to an AAC determined by the chief forester for the non-GBR part of a partial GBR timber supply area, the references to "timber supply area" in that section are to be read as if they were references to "non-GBR part of a partial GBR timber supply area".

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definitions for Part 5

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this Part:

bcl:text.#text: , in relation to an AAC partition specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for a relevant timber supply area or relevant tree farm licence area, means a forest licence, other than an exempt forest licence, that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: specifies, as the area in which the holder of the licence may harvest Crown timber, a timber supply area or tree farm licence area located, in whole or in part, in the partitioned area, and
does not require that timber harvesting under the licence be restricted to an area located, in whole, outside the partitioned area;

bcl:text.#text: , in relation to an AAC partition specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for a relevant tree farm licence area, means a tree farm licence that describes, as the tree farm licence area, an area located, in whole or in part, in the partitioned area;
means
a forest licence that specifies an allowable annual cut of 10 000 m or less, or
a non-replaceable forest licence referred to in paragraph (b) of the definition of "exempted licence" in section 75.01 (1) of the ;
means an order under section 34 (1) or (2);
, in relation to an AAC partition specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council, means the area that is subject to the AAC partition specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council;
means an area that is one of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a GBR timber supply area;
a new non-GBR timber supply area;
the GBR part of a partial GBR timber supply area;
the non-GBR part of a partial GBR timber supply area;
part of an area referred to in paragraph (a), (b), (c) or (d);

bcl:text.#text: means an area that is one of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a GBR tree farm licence area;
the north part of a GBR tree farm licence area;
the south part of a GBR tree farm licence area;
the GBR part of a partial GBR tree farm licence area;
the non-GBR part of a partial GBR tree farm licence area;
part of an area referred to in paragraph (a), (b), (c), (d) or (e).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For certainty,

bcl:text.#text: an affected forest licence includes a forest licence that is an affected forest licence as a result of deemed amendments made to that licence under section 30 , and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an exempt forest licence includes a forest licence that is an exempt forest licence as a result of deemed amendments made to that licence under section 30.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Partition orders

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: At any time while an AAC partition specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council is in effect for a relevant timber supply area, the minister may by order, if the minister considers it necessary to ensure that the AAC partition specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council is carried out, specify a limit on the harvested volume for an affected forest licence in respect of one or more of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a type of timber or terrain in parts of Crown land within the partitioned area;
different areas of Crown land within the partitioned area.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: At any time while an AAC partition specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council is in effect for a relevant tree farm licence area, the minister may by order, if the minister considers it necessary to ensure that the AAC partition specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council is carried out, specify a limit on the harvested volume for any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the affected tree farm licence, in respect of one or more of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a type of timber or terrain in parts of Crown land within the partitioned area;
different areas of Crown land within the partitioned area;
a type of timber or terrain in different parts of private land within the partitioned area;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an affected forest licence, in respect of one or more of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a type of timber or terrain in parts of Crown land within the partitioned area;
different areas of Crown land within the partitioned area.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In making a partition order under subsection (1) or (2) (b), the minister may specify a limit that applies in relation to 2 or more affected forest licences held by the same person.

For certainty, if the minister specifies one limit that applies to 2 or more affected forest licences held by the same person, the holder of those affected forest licences may harvest any portion, including all or nothing, of the harvested volume under any of the affected forest licences that are subject to the limit.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Contents and term of partition orders

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A partition order must specify the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the term of the order;
the AAC partition specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council in respect of which the order is made;
in respect of each licence for which the order is made, the harvested volume limit that the holder of the licence may not exceed during the term of that order.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite the term specified in a partition order, the partition order ceases to have effect when the AAC partition specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council in respect of which the order is made ceases to have effect.

bcl:text.#text: A partition order that relates to an AAC partition specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for a relevant timber supply area is deemed to be an order made by the minister under section 75.02 (2)  of the .

A partition order that relates to an AAC partition specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for a relevant tree farm licence area is deemed to be an order made by the minister under section 75.02 (3) of the .

bcl:text.in:desc: [application of Forest Act to AAC partitions specified under this Act]
bcl:text.#text: Despite section 25  and subsections (1) and (2) of this section,

the minister may not exercise a power under section 75.02 (2), (3) or (8) of the  in relation to an AAC partition specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for a relevant timber supply area or a relevant tree farm licence area, and
the following provisions of the  and regulations under that Act do not apply in relation to a partition order:
regulations under section 75.07 (1) (a) and (d) .

bcl:division.bcl:text: Cut Control Options for North Part of GBR Forest Management Area

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definitions for Division 1 of Part 6

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this Division:

bcl:text.#text: , in relation to a notice of termination or notice of extension, means the calendar year in which the notice of termination or notice of extension is delivered;

, in relation to an eligible forest licence, eligible tree farm licence or partially eligible tree farm licence, means the cut control period that applies to the licence at the time the holder of that licence delivers a notice of termination or notice of extension;
means a forest licence that meets the following requirements:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the licence has a term of more than 5 years;
the licence

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: specifies, as the area in which the holder of that licence may harvest Crown timber, a GBR timber supply area or GBR tree farm licence area located, in whole, in the north part of the GBR forest management area, or
requires that timber harvesting under that licence be restricted to an area located, in whole, in the north part of the GBR forest management area;

bcl:text.#text: means a tree farm licence that meets the following requirements:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the licence has a term of more than 5 years;
the licence describes, as the tree farm licence area, a GBR tree farm licence area;
the GBR tree farm licence area described in the licence is located, in whole, in the north part of the GBR forest management area;

bcl:text.#text: , in relation to a current cut control period, means to extend the cut control period by delivering a notice of extension;
means a notice of extension under section 38 (5);
means a notice of termination under section 38 (3);

bcl:text.in:desc: [notional division of partially eligible tree farm licences]
bcl:text.#text: , in relation to a partially eligible tree farm licence, means the period described in section 41 (4) ;

bcl:text.in:term: notional tree farm licence for GBR north
bcl:text.#text: , in relation to a partially eligible tree farm licence, means the notional tree farm licence referred to in section 41 (1) (a) and described in section 41 (2);

bcl:text.in:term: notional tree farm licence for GBR south
bcl:text.#text: , in relation to a partially eligible tree farm licence, means the notional tree farm licence referred to in section 41 (1) (b) and described in section 41 (3);
means a tree farm licence that meets the following requirements:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the licence has a term of more than 5 years;
the licence describes, as the tree farm licence area, a GBR tree farm licence area;
the GBR tree farm licence area described in the licence is located, in part, in the north part of the GBR forest management area;
there is an AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for the north part and for the south part of the GBR tree farm licence area described in the licence;

bcl:text.#text: , in relation to a current cut control period, means to terminate the cut control period by delivering a notice of termination.
For certainty, an eligible forest licence includes a forest licence that is an eligible forest licence as a result of deemed amendments made to that licence under section 30 .

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Options to obtain longer cut control period

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The holder of an eligible forest licence or eligible tree farm licence may obtain a longer cut control period for the licence by doing one of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: terminating under subsection (3) the current cut control period for that licence;
extending under subsection (5) the current cut control period for that licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The holder of a partially eligible tree farm licence may obtain a longer cut control period for the notional tree farm licence for GBR north by doing one of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: terminating under subsection (3) the current cut control period for the partially eligible tree farm licence;
extending under subsection (5) the current cut control period for the notional tree farm licence for GBR north.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: To terminate the current cut control period for the following licences, the holder of the licence must deliver a written notice of termination to the minister after January 1 and before June 30 of a calendar year ending before 2022:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an eligible forest licence;
an eligible tree farm licence;
a partially eligible tree farm licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The holder of a licence referred to in subsection (3) may terminate only one cut control period for the licence.

To extend the current cut control period for the following licences, the holder of the licence must deliver a written notice of extension to the minister after January 1 and before June 30 of a calendar year ending before 2022:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an eligible forest licence;
an eligible tree farm licence;
a notional tree farm licence for GBR north.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The holder of a licence referred to in subsection (5)

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may extend a current cut control period only once, and
may not extend more than one cut control period.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: New or extended cut control periods for eligible forest licences and eligible tree farm licences

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the holder of an eligible forest licence or eligible tree farm licence terminates the current cut control period for the licence,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the termination takes effect on December 31 of the year immediately preceding the calendar year of delivery,
a new cut control period begins for the licence on January 1 of the calendar year of delivery, and
the new cut control period is the shorter of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: 10 years, and
the number of calendar years remaining in the AAC adjustment period.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the holder of an eligible forest licence or eligible tree farm licence extends the current cut control period for the licence, the extended current cut control period is the shorter of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: 10 years, beginning on January 1 of the calendar year in which that current cut control period began, and
the number of calendar years in the period

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: beginning on January 1 of the calendar year in which that current cut control period began, and
ending on the date the AAC adjustment period ends.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsections (1) (c) and (2) apply despite

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: section 40 (1) and (3), and

bcl:text.#text: sections 75.4 (5) and (6)  and 75.5 (4)  of the .

bcl:marginalnote.#text: Application of  to eligible forest licences and eligible tree farm licences

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a current cut control period is terminated or extended for an eligible forest licence that meets both of the requirements set out in subsection (2), or if a current cut control period is terminated or extended for an eligible tree farm licence,

bcl:text.#text: the licence is, for certainty, a licence as defined in section 75.4 (1)  of the , and
the cut control period determined under this Part for the licence is deemed to be a cut control period determined, for that licence, under section 75.4 of the .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (1) applies to an eligible forest licence if,

bcl:text.#text: immediately before the coming into force of this section, the licence specified an allowable annual cut greater than 10 000 m, and
the licence is not deemed under section 30  to specify an allowable annual cut of 10 000 m or less.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a cut control period is terminated or extended for an eligible forest licence that meets one of the requirements set out in subsection (4),

bcl:text.#text: the licence is, for certainty, a forest licence as defined in section 75.5 (1)  of the , and
the cut control period determined under this Part for the licence is deemed to be a cut control period determined, for that licence, under section 75.5 of the .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (3) applies to an eligible forest licence if,

bcl:text.#text: immediately before the coming into force of this section, the licence specified an allowable annual cut of 10 000 m or less, or
the licence is deemed under section 30 to specify an allowable annual cut of 10 000 m or less.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Notional division of partially eligible tree farm licences

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the holder of a partially eligible tree farm licence delivers a notice of termination or notice of extension, the licence is notionally divided, during the notional division period, into the following 2 licences:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a notional tree farm licence for GBR north;
a notional tree farm licence for GBR south.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In respect of the notional tree farm licence for GBR north,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the notional tree farm licence area is the area comprised of the north part of the GBR tree farm licence area described in the partially eligible tree farm licence, and

the allowable annual cut for the notional tree farm licence area is the AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for the north part of the GBR tree farm licence area described in the partially eligible tree farm licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In respect of the notional tree farm licence for GBR south,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the notional tree farm licence area is the area comprised of the south part of the GBR tree farm licence area described in the partially eligible tree farm licence, and

the allowable annual cut for the notional tree farm licence area is the AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for the south part of the GBR tree farm licence area described in the partially eligible tree farm licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The notional division of a partially eligible tree farm licence under subsection (1) applies during the period

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: beginning on January 1 of the calendar year in which the holder of the partially eligible GBR tree farm licence delivers a notice of termination or notice of extension, and
ending on the date described in section 42 (4).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: New or extended cut control periods for partially eligible tree farm licences

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the holder of a partially eligible tree farm licence terminates the current cut control period for the licence,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in respect of the notional tree farm licence for GBR north,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the termination takes effect on December 31 of the year immediately preceding the calendar year of delivery,
a new cut control period begins on January 1 of the calendar year of delivery, and
the new cut control period is the shorter of

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the number of calendar years remaining in the AAC adjustment period, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in respect of the notional tree farm licence for GBR south,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the termination takes effect on December 31 of the year immediately preceding the calendar year of delivery,
a new cut control period begins on January 1 of the calendar year of delivery, and
subject to subsection (4), the new cut control period is 5 years.

bcl:text.#text: In respect of the new cut control period described in subsection (1) (a) and (b), if there is an excess volume of timber that is required under section 75.7  of the  to be treated as being timber harvested during that new cut control period, the minister must assign the excess volume or portions of that volume that the minister considers appropriate to one or both of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the notional tree farm licence for GBR north, and
the notional tree farm licence for GBR south.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the holder of a partially eligible tree farm licence extends the current cut control period for the notional tree farm licence for GBR north,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the minister must assign the volume of timber harvested under the partially eligible tree farm licence or portions of that volume that the minister considers appropriate to one or both of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the notional tree farm licence for GBR north, and
the notional tree farm licence for GBR south,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in respect of the notional tree farm licence for GBR north, the extended current cut control period is the shorter of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: 10 years, beginning on January 1 of the calendar year in which that current cut control period began, and
the number of calendar years in the period

bcl:clause.bcl:text: beginning on January 1 of the calendar year in which that current cut control period began, and
ending on the date the AAC adjustment period ends, and

bcl:text.#text: in respect of the notional tree farm licence for GBR south, the cut control period is, for certainty, the cut control period determined for that notional licence under section 75.4  of the .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On the date the new cut control period described in subsection (1) (a) (ii) and (iii), or the extended current cut control period described in subsection (3) (b), ends for the notional tree farm licence for GBR north,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the cut control period for the notional tree farm licence for GBR south also ends, and
the notional division of the partially eligible tree farm licence in accordance with section 41 ends in relation to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the next cut control period for that licence, and
any subsequent cut control period for that licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In respect of the next cut control period referred to in subsection (4) (b) (i), if there is an excess volume of timber harvested during the preceding cut control period for the notional tree farm licence for GBR north or the notional tree farm licence for GBR south, the excess volume for that notional licence

bcl:text.#text: must be treated under section 75.7 of the  as being timber harvested during that next cut control period for the partially eligible tree farm licence, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must not be offset by the unharvested volume, if any, relating to the preceding cut control period for the other notional licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsections (1) (a) (iii), (3) (b) and (4) apply despite

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: section 43 of this Act, and

bcl:text.#text: section 75.4 (5) and (6)  of the .

bcl:marginalnote.#text: Application of  to partially eligible tree farm licences

bcl:section.bcl:text: If a cut control period is terminated for a partially eligible tree farm licence or is extended for a notional tree farm licence for GBR north,

bcl:text.#text: the partially eligible tree farm licence is, for certainty, a licence as defined in section 75.4 (1)  of the ,

during the notional division period, the notional tree farm licence for GBR north and the notional tree farm licence for GBR south are deemed to be licences as defined in section 75.4 (1) of the , and

during the notional division period, the cut control periods determined under this Part for the licence and the notional licences are deemed to be cut control periods determined, for that licence and those notional licences, under section 75.4 of the .

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definitions for Division 2 of Part 6

bcl:text.#text: means a limit that is specified or referred to in any of the following provisions of the :

bcl:text.in:desc: [limit on total cut for licences with a term of 5 years or less]
bcl:text.#text: section 75.2 ;
section 75.41 ;
section 75.51 ;
section 75.9 ;
means a penalty under one of the following provisions of the :

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: section 75.2;

bcl:text.#text: section 75.91 ;
means a tree farm licence that describes, as the tree farm licence area, a GBR tree farm licence area;
means a tree farm licence that describes, as the tree farm licence area, a partial GBR tree farm licence area.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Penalty relief for forest licences
bcl:section.bcl:text: The minister may grant to the holder of a forest licence full or partial relief from an eligible penalty if the minister considers that one or more of the following contributed to the contravention of the cut control limit to which the eligible penalty relates:

bcl:text.in:desc: [specification of AACs for affected forest licences and new forest licences]
bcl:text.#text: an allowable annual cut specified for the licence under section 27 (1) ;
a volume assigned to the licence under section 29 (3) (f) ;
an allowable annual cut reduction specified for the licence under section 55 .

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Penalty relief for GBR tree farm licences
bcl:section.bcl:text: The minister may grant to the holder of a GBR tree farm licence full or partial relief from an eligible penalty if the minister considers that one or more of the following contributed to the contravention of the cut control limit to which the eligible penalty relates:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for the GBR tree farm licence area;

bcl:text.in:desc: [new or extended cut control periods for partially eligible tree farm licences]
bcl:text.#text: a volume assigned to the licence under section 42 (2) or (3) ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [deletion of Crown land from commercial licence areas]
bcl:text.#text: a deletion of Crown land from the GBR tree farm licence area under section 54 .

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Penalty relief for partial GBR tree farm licences
bcl:section.bcl:text: The minister may grant to the holder of a partial GBR tree farm licence full or partial relief from an eligible penalty if the minister considers that one or more of the following contributed to the contravention of the cut control limit to which the eligible penalty relates:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for the GBR part of the partial GBR tree farm licence area;
the AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for the non-GBR part of the partial GBR tree farm licence area;
the AAC determined by the chief forester for the non-GBR part of the partial GBR tree farm licence area;

bcl:text.in:desc: [deletion of Crown land from commercial licence areas]
bcl:text.#text: a deletion of Crown land from the partial GBR tree farm licence area under section 54 ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [regulations adapting cut control for partial GBR tree farm licences]
bcl:text.#text: a volume assigned to the licence by regulation under section 65 .

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Penalty relief for other licences in relation to special forest management areas

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:text.#text: means a commercial licence, as defined in section 49, other than a tree farm licence;
means the area of land that is described in or is subject to a commercial licence.

bcl:text.in:desc: [deletion of Crown land from commercial licence areas]
bcl:text.#text: The minister may grant to the holder of a commercial licence full or partial relief from an eligible penalty if the minister considers that a deletion of Crown land from the commercial licence area under section 54  contributed to the contravention of the cut control limit to which the eligible penalty relates.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definitions for Part 7

bcl:text.#text: , in relation to a commercial licence, cutting permit or road permit, means an individual who is authorized under the  to enter into, issue or grant the licence or permit;
means the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a Christmas tree permit;
a community forest agreement;
a community salvage licence;
a first nations woodland licence;
a timber licence;
a timber sale licence;
a tree farm licence;
a woodlot licence;

bcl:text.#text: means the area of land that is described in or is subject to a commercial licence;
means the area described in a timber licence;
means the area described in a timber sale licence.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Designation of special forest management areas
bcl:section.bcl:text: During or after the end of the AAC adjustment period, the Lieutenant Governor in Council may by regulation designate land in the GBR forest management area as a special forest management area.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prohibition on new commercial licences and cutting permits
bcl:section.bcl:text: An authorized official must not enter into a commercial licence or issue a cutting permit that would allow a person to harvest Crown timber in a special forest management area.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prohibition on new road permits

bcl:text.in:desc: [road permits and road use permits for timber harvesting]
bcl:text.#text: Despite section 115  of the , an authorized official may refuse to grant a road permit to construct or maintain a road in a special forest management area if the authorized official considers that construction or maintenance of the road would significantly impair the management and conservation of forest resources on Crown land in the special forest management area.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prohibition on harvesting under existing cutting permits

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies to a cutting permit if

bcl:text.#text: the cutting permit is issued before land is designated under section 50  as a special forest management area, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the area that is subject to the cutting permit is located, in whole or in part, in the special forest management area.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may by order prohibit a person from harvesting Crown timber in a special forest management area under a cutting permit to which this section applies.
A cutting permit that is subject to an order under subsection (2) is deemed to be amended to exclude the special forest management area from the area that is subject to the cutting permit.
