The minister must serve a copy of an order made under this section on the holder of the cutting permit to which the order relates, but the order is not invalid only because the order is not served.

bcl:text.in:desc: [how notice or document may be served]
bcl:text.#text: Section 140  of the  applies in relation to service of an order under subsection (4) of this section.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Deletion of Crown land from commercial licence areas

bcl:text.#text: In this section, , in relation to a special forest management area, means a commercial licence area or the part of a commercial licence area located in the special forest management area.

On the effective date of a regulation under section 50  that designates land as a special forest management area, all Crown land in each relevant commercial licence area is deleted from the commercial licence area.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a commercial licence area located, in whole, in a special forest management area is deleted under subsection (2), the minister may cancel the commercial licence.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Reductions to AAC of forest licences
bcl:section.bcl:text: During or after the end of the AAC adjustment period, the Lieutenant Governor in Council may by regulation specify the amount, if any, by which the Lieutenant Governor in Council considers the allowable annual cut of a forest licence is reduced as a result of the designation of land as a special forest management area.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Deemed amendments to Christmas tree permits and community salvage licences

bcl:text.in:desc: [deletion of Crown land from commercial licence areas]
bcl:text.#text: Each Christmas tree permit and community salvage licence that is affected by a deletion under section 54  is deemed to be amended to reflect the deletion under that section.
Application of  and Compensation

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Deletions to tree farm licence areas

in:desc: [deletion of Crown land from commercial licence areas]
[other deletions of Crown land — tree farm licences]
bcl:text.#text: A deletion of Crown land from a tree farm licence area under section 54  is deemed to be a deletion made, for another purpose, by order of the minister under section 60.2  of the .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite subsection (1), in relation to a deletion to which that subsection applies,

bcl:text.in:desc: [compensation in respect of tree farm licence areas]
bcl:text.#text: the definitions of "current allowable annual cut" and "original allowable annual cut" in section 60.6 (1)  of the  do not apply, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the following definitions are substituted:

bcl:text.#text: means the allowable annual cut that is specified by regulation as the current allowable annual cut for the tree farm licence area;
means the allowable annual cut that is specified by regulation as the original allowable annual cut for the tree farm licence area.
Despite subsection (1), in relation to a deletion to which that subsection applies, section 60.6 (4) of the  is to be read as if the reference to "in the opinion of the chief forester" were excluded.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Deletions to community forest agreement areas, first nations woodland licence areas and woodlot licence areas

bcl:text.in:desc: [deletion of Crown land from commercial licence areas]
bcl:text.#text: A deletion under section 54  of Crown land from

bcl:text.in:desc: [other deletions of Crown land — community forest agreements, first nations woodland licences, woodlot licences and timber licences]
bcl:text.#text: a community forest agreement area is deemed to be a deletion made, for another purpose, by order of the minister under section 60.3 (a)  of the ,
a first nations woodland licence area is deemed to be a deletion made, for another purpose, by order of the minister under section 60.3 (b) of the , and
a woodlot licence area is deemed to be a deletion made, for another purpose, by order of the minister under section 60.3 (c) of the .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite subsection (1), in relation to a deletion to which that subsection applies,

bcl:text.in:desc: [compensation in respect of community forest agreement, first nations woodland licence and woodlot licence areas]
bcl:text.#text: the definitions of "current allowable annual cut" and "original allowable annual cut" in section 60.7 (1)  of the  do not apply, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the following definitions are substituted:

bcl:text.#text: means the allowable annual cut that is specified by regulation as the current allowable annual cut for the community forest agreement area, first nations woodland licence area or woodlot licence area;

means the allowable annual cut that is specified by regulation as the original allowable annual cut for the community forest agreement area, first nations woodland licence area or woodlot licence area.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Deletions to timber licence areas and timber sale licence areas

in:desc: [deletion of Crown land from commercial licence areas]
[other deletions of Crown land — community forest agreements, first nations woodland licences, woodlot licences and timber licences]
bcl:text.#text: A deletion of Crown land from a timber licence area or timber sale licence area under section 54  is deemed to be a deletion made, for another purpose, by order of the minister under section 60.3 (d)  of the .
In applying the  in relation to a deletion to which subsection (1) applies,
the references to "timber licence" in sections 60.51, 60.8, 60.91 (3), 60.92, 60.94 and 60.95 of the  are to be read as if they included references to "timber sale licence", and
the references to "timber licence area" in sections 60.8 and 60.91 (3) of the  are to be read as if they included references to "timber sale licence area".

bcl:text.in:desc: [reductions in allowable annual cut under forest licences and timber sale licences]
bcl:text.#text: For certainty, in relation to a timber sale licence area, a deletion to which subsection (1) applies is not deemed to be a reduction made under section 60.4  of the .

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Reductions in AAC under forest licences

in:desc: [reductions in allowable annual cut under forest licences and timber sale licences]
bcl:text.#text: A reduction specified for a forest licence under section 55  is deemed to be a reduction made, for another purpose, by order of the minister under section 60.4 (a)  of the .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite subsection (1), in relation to a reduction to which that subsection applies,

bcl:text.in:desc: [compensation in respect of forest licences or timber sale licences]
bcl:text.#text: the definitions of "current allowable annual cut" and "original allowable annual cut" in section 60.9 (1)  of the  do not apply, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the following definitions are substituted:

bcl:text.#text: means the allowable annual cut that is specified by regulation as the current allowable annual cut for the forest licence;
means the allowable annual cut that is specified by regulation as the original allowable annual cut for the forest licence.

in:desc: [deletions to community forest agreement areas, first nations woodland licence areas and woodlot licence areas]
[deletions to timber licence areas and timber sale licence areas]
[notice of an order under sections 60, 60.01 or 60.2 to 60.4]
bcl:text.#text: Despite sections 57 (1) , 58 (1) , 59  and 60 (1), section 60.5  of the  does not apply in relation to either of the following:

bcl:text.in:desc: [deletion of Crown land from commercial licence areas]
bcl:text.#text: an intended deletion under section 54  of this Act of Crown land from a tree farm licence area, community forest agreement area, first nations woodland licence area, woodlot licence area, timber licence area or timber sale licence area;
an intended reduction under section 55  of this Act of the allowable annual cut of a forest licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This Act, and the regulations and orders made under this Act, prevail to the extent of any conflict or inconsistency with the following:

bcl:text.#text: the , and enactments and agreements under that Act, except to the extent set out in subsections (2) and (3) of this section;
the  and enactments under that Act;

bcl:link.in:doc: Forest Practices Code of British Columbia Act

bcl:text.#text: the  and enactments under that Act;
the  and enactments under that Act;
an order made under section 93.4  of the .

A designation or order made by the minister, after the end of the AAC adjustment period, under section 7  of the  prevails to the extent of any conflict or inconsistency with a regulation made under section 8  of this Act.

Subject to subsection (4), Part 13  of the , and the regulations and orders made under that Part, prevail to the extent of any conflict or inconsistency with this Act, and the regulations and orders made under this Act.

in:desc.#text: [application of  to AACs specified under this Act]

in:desc: [effect of reduction on annual allowable cut determination]
bcl:text.#text: Despite sections 8 (2) and 16 (1) , the chief forester must not, during the AAC adjustment period, make a determination in accordance with section 173.1 (3)  of the  in relation to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a GBR timber supply area,
a GBR tree farm licence area,
a partial GBR timber supply area, or
a partial GBR tree farm licence area.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: No compensation

bcl:text.#text: Except to the extent contemplated under Division 3  of Part 7 , and despite any enactment or law to the contrary, compensation and damages are not payable by the government in relation to any of the following matters:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the enactment of this Act or a regulation or order under this Act;
the exercise or intended exercise of a power under this Act including, without limitation, the following:

bcl:text.#text: the power of the Lieutenant Governor in Council under Part 4  to specify allowable annual cuts and harvesting areas for affected forest licences and to impose restrictions on timber harvesting under those licences;

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the power of the Lieutenant Governor in Council under Part 7 to designate land as a special forest management area;

bcl:text.#text: the power of the Lieutenant Governor in Council under section 66  to make regulations.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person has no right of action and must not commence or maintain an action or other proceeding

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: to claim compensation or damages from the government in relation to a matter referred to in subsection (1), or
to obtain a declaration that compensation or damages is payable by the government in relation to a matter referred to in subsection (1).

bcl:text.#text: The  does not apply in relation to a matter referred to in subsection (1) of this section.
Section 5  of the  does not apply to this Act or regulations or orders made under this Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Regulations adapting cut control for partial GBR tree farm licences

bcl:text.#text: In this section,  means a tree farm licence that meets the following requirements:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the licence describes, as the tree farm licence area, a partial GBR tree farm licence area;
an allowable annual cut referred to in subsection (2) is specified or determined in relation to the partial GBR tree farm licence area described in the licence.

bcl:text.#text: During the AAC adjustment period, the Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations the Lieutenant Governor in Council considers necessary for the purposes of adapting Division 3.1  of Part 4  of the , and regulations under that Division, to take into account any or all of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for the GBR part of a partial GBR tree farm licence area;
an AAC specified by the Lieutenant Governor in Council for the non-GBR part of a partial GBR tree farm licence area;
an AAC determined by the chief forester for the non-GBR part of a partial GBR tree farm licence area.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Without limiting subsection (2), the Lieutenant Governor in Council may by regulation do any or all of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: notionally divide a partial GBR tree farm licence into the following 2 licences:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a notional licence for the GBR part of the partial GBR tree farm licence area;
a notional licence for the non-GBR part of the partial GBR tree farm licence area;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: authorize the minister to assign the volume of timber harvested under a partial GBR tree farm licence or portions of that volume that the minister considers appropriate to a notional licence referred to in paragraph (a);

bcl:text.#text: specify that a provision under Division 3.1 of Part 4 of the  does not apply in relation to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a partial GBR tree farm licence, or
a notional licence referred to in paragraph (a) of this subsection;

bcl:text.#text: impose a condition, requirement, restriction or prohibition in relation to either of the following that is in addition to, or different from, a provision under Division 3.1 of Part 4 of the :

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a partial GBR tree farm licence;
a notional licence referred to in paragraph (a) of this subsection;

bcl:text.#text: specify that a condition, requirement, restriction or prohibition imposed by a regulation under this section is deemed to be a condition, requirement, restriction or prohibition imposed under Division 3.1 of Part 4 of the .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:text.#text: has the same meaning as in section 1 of the ;
has the same meaning as in section 1 of the .
During or after the end of the AAC adjustment period and despite the , the Lieutenant Governor in Council may by regulation do any of the following:
specify that a provision of the , or an enactment under that Act, does not apply in relation to the GBR forest management area;

in relation to forest practices and operational plans respecting the GBR forest management area, impose standards, conditions, requirements, restrictions or prohibitions that are in addition to, or different from, the standards, conditions, requirements, restrictions or prohibitions under the ;

specify that a standard, condition, requirement, restriction or prohibition imposed by a regulation under this section is deemed to be a standard, condition, requirement, restriction or prohibition imposed under the .

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Restrictions on certain regulation-making powers

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies to regulations under the following provisions:

bcl:text.in:desc: [maximum AAC for GBR forest management area]
bcl:text.#text: section 7 (1) ;
section 8 (1) ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [AAC for GBR timber supply areas and GBR tree farm licence areas]
bcl:text.#text: section 9 (1) and (2) ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [AAC for new non-GBR timber supply areas]
bcl:text.#text: section 11 (1) ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [AAC for partial GBR timber supply areas and partial GBR tree farm licence areas]
bcl:text.#text: section 13 (1), (2) and (3) ;
section 17 (1) ;
section 18 (1) ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [AAC partitions for GBR timber supply areas and GBR tree farm licence areas]
bcl:text.#text: section 21 (1) ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [AAC partitions for new non-GBR timber supply areas]
bcl:text.#text: section 22 (1) ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [AAC partitions for partial GBR timber supply areas and partial GBR tree farm licence areas]
bcl:text.#text: section 23 (1), (2) and (3) ;
paragraph (c) of the definition of "exempt forest licence" in section 26 (1) ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [specification of AACs for affected forest licences and new forest licences]
bcl:text.#text: section 27 (1) ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [specification of harvesting areas for affected forest licences]
bcl:text.#text: section 28 (1), (2) and (3) ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [regulations adapting cut control for partial GBR tree farm licences]
bcl:text.#text: section 65 .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Regulations under a provision to which this section applies

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may be made or amended only during the AAC adjustment period, and
may be repealed during or after the end of the AAC adjustment period.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Regulations respecting other matters
bcl:section.bcl:text: The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations respecting any matter for which regulations are contemplated by the following provisions of this Act:

bcl:text.in:desc: [general application of Forest Act to this Act]
bcl:text.#text: section 2 (4) (b) ;
paragraph (c) of the definition of "exempt forest licence" in section 26 (1) ;
section 57 (2) ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [deletions to community forest agreement areas, first nations woodland licence areas and woodlot licence areas]
bcl:text.#text: section 58 (2) ;
section 60 (2) .

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: General regulation-making authority

bcl:text.#text: The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations referred to in section 41  of the .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The authority to make regulations under another provision of this Act does not limit subsection (1).
In making a regulation under this Act, the Lieutenant Governor in Council may do one or more of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: delegate a matter to a person;
confer a discretion on a person;
make different regulations for different persons, places, things, circumstances or transactions, or classes of persons, places, things, circumstances or transactions;
establish or define classes of persons, places, things, circumstances or transactions.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Repealed
Transitional regulations — substitution of actual dates

bcl:text.#text: The Lieutenant Governor in Council may by regulation amend the definition of "AAC adjustment period" in section 1  by striking out "the date section 6  comes into force" and substituting the actual date that section comes into force.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The Lieutenant Governor in Council may by regulation amend the following provisions of this Act by striking out "the coming into force of this section" and substituting the actual date the applicable section comes into force:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the definitions of "north part" and "south part" in section 1;

bcl:text.#text: paragraphs (a) and (b) of the definition of "affected forest licence" in section 26 (1) ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [specification of AACs for affected forest licences and new forest licences]
bcl:text.#text: section 27 (3) ;

in:desc.#text: [application of  to eligible forest licences and eligible tree farm licences]

bcl:text.#text: section 40 (2) (a) and (4) (a) .

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Commencement
bcl:section.bcl:text: This Act comes into force by regulation of the Lieutenant Governor in Council.
